item.title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson says UK is past the peak of outbreak
item.description: Boris Johnson says he will set out a plan next week on the economy, schools and transport beyond lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump seems to undercut US spies on virus origins
item.description: US spies said it was not yet clear how the outbreak began, but Mr Trump suggests it came from a lab.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'We go hungry so we can feed our children'
item.description: A growing number of families are struggling to put food on the table during the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: High microplastic concentration found on ocean floor
item.description: Mediterranean sediments are shown to have up to 1.9 million tiny plastic pieces per square metre.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK's weekly clap for carers
item.description: For the sixth week in a row, people clapped to show appreciation for health workers.

item.title: Afrobeat pioneer Tony Allen dies aged 79
item.description: Nigerian drummer Tony Allen, who created Afrobeat with Fela Kuti, dies aged 79, his manager says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Armed protesters enter Michigan statehouse
item.description: Several senators reportedly wore bulletproof vests as armed demonstrators looked on from the gallery.

item.title: Apple boosted by streaming services despite lockdown
item.description: While iPhone sales fell due to the lockdown in China, sales of streaming services jumped.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Boots offers safe space for domestic abuse victims
item.description: People living with abuse will be able to use the pharmacy's consultation rooms to contact helplines.

item.title: Coronavirus: Brian May says the shortage of PPE is 'horrendous'
item.description: The guitarist says he is 'angry and sad' over the situation, as Queen release a new charity single.

item.title: Amazon investors told to 'take a seat' as demand jumps
item.description: Amazon's sales surged 26%, but costs are also up due to spending on safety precautions and wages.

item.title: Coronavirus: Calls for clarity as tips due to reopen
item.description: Some authorities say waste sites will reopen at the weekend, while others say further guidance is needed.

item.title: Coronavirus: More than 9,000 fines for lockdown breaches
item.description: Police leaders say that while compliance is holding up overall, warmer weather could be a challenge.

item.title: The Papers: 'Roadmap' for lockdown exit as UK passes virus peak
item.description: The PM's first daily briefing since recovering from Covid-19 features on most of Friday's front pages.

item.title: Ramadan and Coronavirus: Breaking my fast on Zoom
item.description: How fasting in lockdown and isolation has changed Ramadan for young Muslims this year.

item.title: Quiz of the Week: On UFOs, lockdown loosening and more
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Coronavirus: What it's like to be shielding in your twenties
item.description: Grace, 26, doesn't look it but she's deemed extremely vulnerable - here's how she's dealing with having to shield.

item.title: Nordic Islands seen in their 'surreal light'
item.description: The breathtaking landscapes of Iceland, Greenland, Norway and the Faroe Islands.

item.title: Coronavirus: When your child's in intensive care with Covid-19
item.description: Two mothers tell the BBC about their experiences as their young children battled the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Madrid's balcony cinema screens films for people in lockdown
item.description: People in Madrid can watch films from their balconies after the local council brought in huge screens.

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I help?
item.description: Giving blood, writing a diary, or reading a story to your friends' children are just some of the options.

item.title: Coronavirus: Three continents, four lives, one day
item.description: The stories of people who died on one day, from an exile who returned home to a disaster survivor.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Many said goodbye to loved ones in an ambulance'
item.description: Dr Nigel Kennea describes his role supporting bereaved families at one London hospital during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: How The Assistant exposes Hollywood's abuse silence
item.description: The movie which has roots in the exposure of power and abuse in the film industry after #MeToo.

item.title: The worldwide race to make solar power more efficient
item.description: Scientists are working on better solar cells that will turn more of the sun's rays into electricity.

item.title: ‘Justice not charity’ - the blind marchers who made history
item.description: Remembering the maverick blind campaigners who walked to London a century ago to demand equality.

item.title: Lockdown homeschooling: The parents who have forgotten what they learned at school
item.description: Parents have been turning to Google to help them teach the things they’ve forgotten.

item.title: Majority of players scared about returning - Aguero
item.description: Players are "scared" about the prospect of returning to action amid the coronavirus pandemic, says Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero.

item.title: Government approves £16m in loans to 'protect sport'
item.description: Rugby league in England will receive £16m in government loans to help it recover from the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Man Utd favour Grealish move over Maddison - football gossip
item.description: Man Utd prefer Grealish over Maddison, Real Madrid and Barcelona join Sancho race, Arsenal to fight AC Milan for Fekir, plus more.

item.title: Ex-world champion Ebdon retires because of neck injury
item.description: Former world champion Peter Ebdon announces his retirement from snooker because of a chronic neck injury.

item.title: Jesse Lingard: Can you keep up with his 40-minute workout?
item.description: Man Utd's Jesse Lingard presents a 40-minute workout with three rounds of four sets of exercises, including cardio, core and strength - and a bonus round if you can hack it!

item.title: PSG awarded French title after season ends early
item.description: Paris St-Germain are awarded the Ligue 1 title after it was announced the season would not resume because of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Why The Hundred's postponement will be felt throughout English cricket
item.description: After The Hundred is postponed until 2021, BBC Sport investigates the effect it will have on players and counties.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus: How close is the UK to 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should the public wear face masks?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are international comparisons difficult?
item.description: Should you be comparing Covid-19 statistics between countries?

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is among those to be treated in hospital for the symptoms of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Everybody should be avoiding non-essential contact, and you should stay at home wherever possible.

item.title: Coronavirus: A visual guide to the economic impact
item.description: Key maps and charts explain how the virus has impacted markets and businesses around the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Coronavirus: The world in lockdown in maps and charts
item.description: With more than a million coronavirus cases confirmed worldwide, an analysis of the world in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What do all the terms mean?
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak

item.title: What is the coronavirus?
item.description: Everything you need to know about the coronavirus – explained in just one minute.

item.title: Coronavirus death rate: What are the chances of dying?
item.description: The current best guess of a 1% death rate does not apply to everyone.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will the outbreak end and life get back to normal?
item.description: The huge challenge the world faces to find an exit strategy to end the lockdowns and return to normal.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'How I'm coping with self-isolation'
item.description: With the impact that coronavirus is having on our daily lives, people are finding new ways to fill their free time.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I'm begging you, please be careful'
item.description: A woman being treated for coronavirus has made an appeal for people to stay home.

item.title: Coronavirus update: Why does staying at home help?
item.description: After Boris Johnson brings in new measures, the BBC explains why staying in is a matter of life and death.

item.title: Ultra-Orthodox and trans: 'I prayed to God to make me a girl'
item.description: Growing up as a Hasidic Jew, Abby Stein had no idea trans people existed - she just felt sure she was a girl.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I never thought I'd be so proud to sell bread and butter'
item.description: Laura McLellan felt humbled when she and her team of checkout operators were told they were key workers.

item.title: 'Nobody told us about the coronavirus pandemic'
item.description: Before setting sail around the world, Elena and Ryan told their families not to give them bad news.

item.title: Coronavirus: Protecting the 'one in a million' girl
item.description: Bex Price's family went into isolation early as coronavirus would almost certainly kill her.

item.title: Coronavirus: Making face masks feels 'like the war effort'
item.description: Thousands of people are producing cloth masks, despite UK authorities saying they are unnecessary.

item.title: Coronavirus journey: The 'last cruise ship on Earth' finally comes home
item.description: From political storms to presidential pleas, it has been quite a journey for the MSC Magnifica.

item.title: The tiny premature baby who fought off coronavirus
item.description: Peyton Maguire from Lanarkshire is one of the youngest Covid-19 patients in the UK.

item.title: How Typhoid Mary left a trail of scandal and death
item.description: The chilling story of an Irish immigrant cook who brought typhoid to well-to-do families in New York.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grandmas' top tips to get through lockdown
item.description: We've asked Grannies from around the world for their advice on staying positive.

item.title: A coronavirus survivor's story: 'I touched death'
item.description: Elizabeth says she feels lucky to be alive after falling seriously ill with the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Wacky and wonderful scrubs for NHS workers
item.description: Hundreds of volunteers are making scrubs of all different designs and colours for doctors and nurses.
